I just had to e mail her as soon as my foot touched the mainland. and better yet, I had the opportunity to take a quick look at the unit it was amazing! there was no comparison to the unit that we had stayed in. Hands down this unit was the most luxurious that I have ever seen I have already started talking about reserving that unit for my wedding and I can't wait to be the one that everyone is admiring from their balconies!

Reviews.Title: “Our family Christmas Vacation was a disaster!!”
Reviews.Author: UtahVacationbound
Reviews.Content: Our entire family of 12, 6 adults and 6 kids(ages 11-19) eagerly awaited our 7 day vacation in Maui!!! We booked through Maui Holidays and Glen raved about the Hale Mahina. We were never warned that the property managers at the resort, DID NOT WANT CHILDREN THERE!!! From the moment we arrived, we were harassed and told to be quiet. Even when we were just enjoying dinner on the Lanai and the children were inside watching TV! We were threatened with eviction, unjustly accused of using foul language, and constantly felt we were walking on egg shells. I later learned from another employee of Chasen Rainbows, that similar things had happened and she did not recommend the resort to anyone with children. If our party had been all adults, we likely would have had a wonderful time but the property managers made the week a nightmare for our 6 lovely granddaughters - all of whom are VERY well behaved and have NEVER caused a problem! The adults, have rented condos in Oceanside Ca for over 8 years and have never once had a complaint on their behavior!! When push came to shove - our travel agent did not support us with our problem with the property manager, although he was the first to say that the property managers "had it in for us before we arrived!" Our advice - if you are a family -NEVER think about staying at the Hale Mahina!! Also, the Aloha spirit that we knew in Maui in 1988 is DEAD. The residents no longer are friendly nor care about the tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: michtravelerBrighton
Reviews.Content: Wonderful week stay at Hale Mahina with spouse and 3 kids- 11,14,17. Great pool and hot tub area, facing the ocean. Often we were the only ones in the pool or hot tub. Grassy area for lawn chairs (sun and shade). Beachfront- not the best for swimming, but good for boogie boarding, snorkeling, and shell seeking. # bedroom unit was updated- views from every room. Sunset views unbelievable. Very quiet and low key condo resort- we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous ocean front views, private beach but it has it's cons...”
Reviews.Author: huladolz
Reviews.Content: We, family with kids, stayed at the Hale Mahina in June 2007. Our first family trip to Maui and after reading the last post, I feel a bit guilty for not posting after our trip. Here are the pros and cons during our stay- Pros of the Unit A205- Ocean front, water was 40-50 feet away, gorgeous unit, completely remodeled, granite slab kitchen counter, new SS appliances, new bathroom, new W/D, nice new hawaiian ratten furniture, big lanai with gorgeous ocean views, beautiful sunsets. We rented thru chasenrainbows and they were great to work with! You can see pictures on their site. Cons of A-205- everything was nicely remodeled but the comforter on the bed was so old and grungy. I threw it off immediately and wondered why? Everything was newly remodeled and a comforter is such an easy, inexpensive thing to change. Bathroom was really small- 3'x4' in front of 2 sinks and 2'x2' by the tub and toilet area, and not much ventilation so the mirrors really fogged up when taking a shower or drying laundry. The lanai only had a small table and 2 chairs, it would have been nice to have a bigger table with more chairs to eat out there and a chaise as well to lounge on listening to the waves. Biggest Con is NO AC which I thought I would be ok with but I was wrong! There were a couple nights were the trade winds were low and it was muggy hot and hard to sleep. It would cool down if you left your front door open and lanai screen open but we only did it for awhile as this isn't safe with a 2 year old. Pros of Hale Mahina Resort- Gorgeous private beach/ small cove, maybe 25' deep and 80-90' wide, you must stay at Hale Mahina or Lokelani next door to have access. There is a gate and it is locked so you need a key. The beach had grainy sand, it steeped quite a bit and the waves were rough when we went. At night the beach is entirely covered at high tide. Grounds are well kept and beautiful. Great location in Honokowai- 5 min. to Kaanapali, 10 min. to Lahaina, 10 min. to Napili and Kapalua. Cons of Hale Mahina Resort- No shade on the beach in the afternoon, only in the morning is there shade from the palm trees. The ocean does steep quite a bit after only a couple feet in so I did not feel safe with the kids boogie boarding there. We only played on the beach twice in our week stay and went to other beaches. The pool is pretty small and the manager did not want my kids playing with their beach ball in the pool and they were the only ones in the pool! He was pretty strict and we were stunned since my kids were behaving well and just wanted to throw a beach ball around. We also stayed at the Grand Wailea for 4 days after, so we thought, "whatever, we'll just get our fun pool time there." This happened on the 2nd day so after that ,we realized that this was not a young family friendly resort and we just explored Maui all day and came back at night to sleep. There is a quiet time after 10pm and there were a couple nights were there were some people bbqing and having a good time outside but I knew, once 10pm came, the manager came out to tell them all to be quiet and go take it to their rooms. For us, there wasn't enough amenities at this resort for us to want to stay here again. There is an abc store and farmers market to walk to but other than that, not much. You do have to drive to go anywhere which it was a great location, pretty close to everything. We could tell that there were many older owners who lived there and they must want the resort very quiet and have the manager making sure of just that. It would have been a better time if he wasn't so strict and I do remember seing another review complaining about the manager but it was taken off. I hope my review stays as I am being honest about the pros and cons ...you spend a lot of money and time researching for a trip to Maui and you want to make sure where you stay is the right place for you. The resort and the unit we stayed in would be perfect for a couple. The views were great but we were excited to move onto to GW with AC and awesome pools! Places not to miss- Snorkeling at Kapalua Beach, Napili Beach, ocean view lunch Aloha Mix Plate, Brunch at the Hyatt Kaanapali, Torchlighting at Black Rock, Free hula shows at KBH and at Whalers Village, Iao Valley, Maui Ocean Center, Wailea Beach, Keawakapu Beach, Alexanders Fish, Chicken and Ribs, Local Boyz Shave Ice and the Barefoot Bar at the Hula Grill for Lava Flows! Aloha!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not The Vacation We Hoped For!”
Reviews.Author: Doubtfire508
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Maui, and after this experience, it will be our last. This complex should be advertised as an over 55 complex, or couples only. We traveled with several families, and were stalked by the resident managers the entire week. No playing in the pool, no games on the grass, basically No Fun, and this is our family vacation! They informed us that they didn't like group reservations, and it would be a problem, so maybe we should 'relocate'. We weren't the only family this happened to, after speaking to other families at the pool, they also had problems. The complex is beautiful, and very well kept. But if you are traveling with children, or in a group, look for a different complex! The trash truck does go through almost every morning, early. The back bedroom gets alot of noise from the street, all night long!

Reviews.Title: “Unit A202!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mauilvr123456
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our recent stay at Hale Mahina Beach Resort Maui. Having stayed there in several occasions in other units I can honestly say I will never stay in any other unit other then A202 again!!! I booked directly from the owner who recently purchased and completely renovated the unit. It is absolutely paradise you don't even have to go outside! The entire process was so amazing she was so easy to work with. The owner Jackie was so Knowledgeable and helpful. She even went as far as helping me with who to fly with and what to do, who to rent a car from, and most important where to eat! Not to mention the pictures of the unit and the view are not exaggerated! THIS UNIT SCORES A PERFECT 10 IN MY BOOK! one more thing, she even leaves a gift basket!!!!!!! ohhh the website is www.alohamahinacondo.com Jane M

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: crisnmel
Reviews.Content: I am ambivalent about writing this review, because then everyone will find out what a great spot it is and I'll never be able to get in there myself again! First of all, Hale Mahina is located in an excellent area, and is one of the few condo complexes that has a small, sandy beach. The pool sits in the middle of a lawn surrounded by palm trees on the water's edge. Larry the manager does a fantastic job of taking care of the place. The lanai views are amazing for all units. For the first week we stayed in B402, and WOW! What a spectacular place. They have thought of everything, and it was just lovely, it really made for a heavenly stay. The second week we stayed in B302, an older unit that was definitely in need of renovation. The slider door took 2 people to open, the kitchen and bathrooms were old, there was no deadbolt on the door, to name a few issues. Also, in all units the second bedroom by the entry door gets a lot of road noise - I used earplugs. Loft bedrooms in 2 bedroom units also get a lot of ocean noise from the waves, but who can complain about that? However, overall, I have to say that Hale Mahina was great. Many times we were the only ones in the pool, and there were at most maybe a dozen people in lounge chairs on the lawn at any one time, much better than the resort experience of swimming in crowded pools full of kids. When I return to Maui, I wil DEFINITELY stay there. My advice to anyone seeking a unit there is to look carefully at the pictures, make sure that the kitchens and bathrooms are in good shape, as there is a wide range of accomodations there. As for the surrounding area, there was an outdoor fruit market 3 days a week just down the street, and you are 2 minutes from the north end of Kaanapali beach - there is free parking and beach access at Kahekili Beach park, with GREAT snorkeling in just a few feet of water (as good as Black Rock, we thought). Eat at Okazuya Honokowai takeout deli, really great food, with many types of dishes that are generous and tasty. Road north of Kapalua was beautiful, lots of rugged coastline, and wish I would have done more of that road then the road to Hana.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: WABeans
Reviews.Content: What an absolutely delightful place. Condos and other amenities are maticulously maintained. Most units are very weill appointed and decorated. Location just north of Kaanapali is quieter and less busy and crowded. Close to stores and takeout foods and a very great farmer's market. The beach is smallish, but private and very clean. Whales appeared daily and green sea turtles occassionally in the early morning. Hosts and managers Larry and Lynne were exceptional. We stayed for almost a month and enjoyed every moment. We plan to stay there again on our next trip to the island.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: lafkim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hale Mahina 3/23-3/29. Individual condo rentals on the property & also permanent residents. Our condo was on the fourth floor (403) and a beautiful ocean view from our lanai. Small private beach with beautiful water clarity, the kids loved it. Nice pool & hot tub. The condo was very nice & clean with many extras, snorkeling gear & boogie boards. This is not a busy resort, very relaxing. As soon as we arrived the kids spotted whales spouting and breaching, brought our own binocs. We sat on our lanai and watched this spectacular event 3 or 4 times a day. We also did local grocery shopping to help cut costs (food is very expensive). Did lunch at Bubba Gumps, Hula Grill & Cheeseburger in Paradise. We enjoyed the tourist thing immensely. We did not spend extra money on snorkeling or whale watching tours as we had this available at our own front door. I purchased a copy of Maui Revealed and this was our tour guide. This book was fantastic and I would recommend it to anyone who has never been to Maui. Everything is dead on even down to the reviews of restaurants. We rented snorkel gear from Boss Frogs and snorkeled with turtles & trumpet fish. Frogs were kind enough to upgrade our gear for free on 2nd day at the beach. Overall we loved Maui and all the things to do. Great experience & will return again without the teens.

HotelInfo.Name: Hale Mahina Beach Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 3875 Lower Honoapiilani Road, Lahaina, Maui, HI 96761
